main event: Captain at Holloman Air Force Base observed an unusual aerial phenomenon at 2215 hours on 7 January 1950.
interesting points: The phenomenon was first seen at a 45-degree angle and descended at approximately a 60-degree angle., The object changed colors from yellowish white to orange, and then to bright blue-green., It had a trailing flame and was round and ball-shaped., The sighting lasted for about 10 seconds., Another reliable witness, Mr. Warren Ratliff, was present during the sighting.
sighted object: one round ball-shaped object with a flame trail
witness description: Captain from Holloman AFB and Mr. Warren Ratliff, Manager of Mountain States Telephone & Telegraph Co.
